alert.note: Alert for Appanoose; Black Hawk; Bremer; Butler; Clarke; Davis; Decatur; Grundy; Hardin; Jasper; Lucas; Madison; Mahaska; Marion; Marshall; Monroe; Polk; Poweshiek; Ringgold; Story; Tama; Union; Wapello; Warren; Wayne (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 11:10AM CST until January 19 at 6:00AM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Snow and Blowing Snow this Afternoon into Tonight, then Bitter Cold... .Snow has begun to move into northwest Iowa and will continue to spread through the area this afternoon and evening before wrapping up overnight tonight. The heaviest snowfall rates are expected in central Iowa around the time of the evening commute, making travel more difficult during this time. The snow will be dry and powdery, making it highly susceptible to blowing and drifting. As the snow departs tonight, winds begin to pick up out of the northwest with gusts of 25 to 35 mph expected through the early morning hours. Expect the fresh, powdery snow to begin blowing around overnight, causing reduced visibility and hazardous driving conditions. Temperatures also drop as the winds pick up, with bitter cold wind chills in the 20s below zero adding an extra layer of risk to travel overnight into Friday morning. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 AM CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of two to five inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Parts of central, eastern, and southern Iowa. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 3 PM this afternoon to 6 AM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to noon CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Bitter cold will persist into the weekend as well with Wind Chill Advisories or Warnings possible Friday night into Saturday morning, and Saturday night into Sunday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511.
